Reviews.Title: International Warranty Beware!
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Purchased a different phone from Amazon.com (not through, but from!) less than 1 year ago with an "International Warranty."  LG USA claims this warranty is worthless.  Further, because phone is not LG USA phone, they claim to be unable to even repair it, even outside of warranty.  They said "maybe" their parent company could do something and referred me to contact LG '', Seoul, Korea, but said they don't know how to even contact them.  Really?!?  They provided me with no contact information.  Unless your Korean language ability is better than mine, you might have trouble even getting a reply.  And unless Amazon is selling the exact same phone and has more in stock (?), they apparently cannot repair or replace the phone.  So, unless somebody out there knows something I don't about this, DO NOT COUNT on a warranty against manufacturer defects.  My phone apparently was a Canadian phone, but perhaps because it wasn't purchased from "Amazon.ca", but Amazon.com, LG Canada refuses to honor any "International warranty."  It seems that an International warranty means internationally, there is NO warranty!  So beware!

Reviews.Title: lg thrill p920
Reviews.Author: Dwonn
Reviews.Content: I received model P925 instead of the P920 that was advertised so I was only able to get 2g speed with tmobile service. I contacted the seller and he apologized for the mishap and promptly sent me a return label to send back the phone. the phone looked good but I wanted 3g speed. Double check with the seller to make sure that you are really getting model P920 if you use tmobile. Model P925 will not allow you to edit the APN setting so beware.

Reviews.Title: Spend a little extra money on something a lot better. Something else.
Reviews.Author: Kean
Reviews.Content: I originally posted this review on eBay, but I had some revisions to make and thought it'd probably reach more people here.There's really no need to waste space talking about the specs of this phone, as you can find all of that elsewhere, but I will mention them in passing.The screen is bright, and despite being 800x480, you get a very clear picture for a budget smartphone.Multitasking is not all they make it out to be on this phone. I need to shut down applications constantly, otherwise my phone begins to lag simply switching between pages on the home screen.I've had to shut down my phone due to freezing multiple times, and though I'm not sure if I should blame it on AT&T; or the phone, on occasion the Thrill will completely shut itself off of any kind of connection (3G/4G/Edge and even wireless, which makes me lean towards the phone being at fault).Don't buy this phone for the 3D, it's cool as a party trick, but the most use you'll likely get out of that aspect is the week succeeding your purchase of the phone. I've had mine for nearly eight months and actually took the time to reroute the 3D menu button as a camera button. I haven't used the 3D itself in a few months.The battery will last maybe 1/2-3/4 of a day with moderate to heavy usage. I downloaded JuiceDefender, which improved the battery life exponentially (now it lasts all day, and a little into the next if I need it).LG's UI isn't the greatest. There are a lot of tiny bugs that become annoying if they happen too often (if someone texts you within a second or so of you receiving or making a phone call, it drops the call, the fact that it takes half of it's pages out of Apple's book, and the other half out of Samsung's (which in turn had already taken it out of Apple's), stuff like that). One of my gripes is with their messaging app, it may just be me, but I like to know when I sent a message. Granted, it shows "Jan 7", but I prefer to see the time it sent, which it does not show. It does, of course, come with bloatware, but not as much as can be seen on other phones (not to say that there is very little, I'd just say their is a normal amount).The worst issue I have with this phone is the lock screen. I generally like to password protect my phone, but doing so with this particular phone brings up an emergency call icon on the lock screen. If I receive a text message, making my screen come on, and I then jostle my leg a little bit it will, almost without fail, call 911. Granted, sometimes it'll just punch in a bunch of random numbers on the keypad, it still makes the call much more often and much more easily than is acceptable.The camera takes (for me) eight or so seconds on average to load up, so I don't even bother reaching for my phone when I see something I want to record, I just try to commit it to memory. If you do have the time to take a picture or a video though, the quality is pretty good for a five-megapixel camera (and for those of you that are wondering, if you are not in 3D mode for picture taking, it uses the top camera).All in all, it's not a bad device, and it's not spectacular. Even for the price, which has gone down, it can't really be described as a poor choice, but their were many minor things that could have been done to make this a significantly better phone. Think of it this way, rather than find a phone that looks good on paper, but is, like this, a budget phone, drop the extra $100-$150 on a phone that works better, and will be updated, because odds are you won't upgrade again until your contract is up. LG is working on newer and better devices, and owners of this device will be and have been left waiting for quite some time for the ICS update, although rumor has it that that will be released in the third quarter of this year.Although I may be contradicting other reviews, and being maybe a little to nitpicky for somewhat of a budget phone, I hope this review helped, and I promise you that anything that is not obviously an opinion of mine (such as the UI) is based on the actual phone. When I wrote this review, I turned on the camera several times to get an accurate grasp of the amount of time it took to load.Update to my original review; I upgraded to Gingerbread. This upgrade was, in my opinion, a break even for the phone. Everything runs slightly smoother now, the UI has been cleaned up a little, but I believe that it has also imbued my phone with a small element of magic. How else do you explain me listening to Continuum, in correct album order, and the music player switching to dubstep IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SONG. My phone is turned off, face down, with absolutely nothing disturbing it when suddenly it turns to the party mix option.

Reviews.Title: How I can give 10 stars?
Reviews.Author: Antonio Ramírez
Reviews.Content: This product is truly amazing, fast, modern, fun and totally spectacular!. The shipment was fast and without problems, the supplier was always aware that everything goes well and that I was fully satisfied. I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Content: I received the phone on time and within my expectations. The android has exceeded all requirements and take pictures and movies in 3D is fantastic. To complete, LG said it will make the android 4.0 for this phone.

Reviews.Title: Just Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Rene
Reviews.Content: I recently buy this smartphone and my firs impression was... A.M.A.Z.I.N.G.I use it everyday with wifi for facebook, hotmail, market, messenger and web browsing and is a incredible smartphone. Also I hace a Nokia N8 with Symbian Belle and few days ago I compare My N8 with a Galaxy with android 2.3 and I prefer my Nokia n8 but when I compare it with this LG Optimus... I just love the Optimus is just awesome, the speed, the touch, the huge screen. The Optimus 3D with froyo was speed but when I upgrade to Gingerbread  is SUPER SPEED also now I have a 3D game converter for every game, and also can see every photo and video in 3D. The battery with froyo was bad but with gingerbread now is better.Some cons I have founds is the camera in 2D, the photos are very compressed and look a little bad, of course for that I have my N8 with 12mpx.But the 3D Camera is just incredible, i can film up to 1080p very good.This phone is the best. With games, no lags, runs very well 9mm and Modern Combat 3 of Gameloft is just a Super Smartphone.Also in this phone, android feel better.PD. sorry for my english, I'm writing from El Salvador, also this phone work great with Tigo company but just in 2G, 3G works with Claro/Telecom Company.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Company and phone

Reviews.Content: 100% recommended very serious people, they gave me the phone in perfect condition very good 3D technology you can enjoy at a glance

Reviews.Title: Finally, "Thrill" Is A Rebranded Name That's Accurate!
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: I've owned this phone for 1mth and used many features often and agree with all of the GREAT THINGS said about this phone (an Android update will come and I bet it'll be 4.0 instead of 2.3, likely by the end of 2011 due to Google's 18mth upgrade promise), but must add ONE CON! Why does this phone not have a charge indicator light?BEFORE YOU BUY, consider, picking up this phone at Costco for $30 w/$FREE accessory kit (too tight case, fine car charger, & ok screen protector)(Sign up for a new Costco membership to save more!)!I bought this phone for the 3D. This is the 2nd 3D phone available in the USA (Sprint HTC EVO 3D was 1st). LG's Thrill 4G does beautiful 3D photos and video and you can even output 3D via HDMI! I think the Thrill 4G phone w/3D is better OVERALL than the EVO 3D, even though the EVO 3D has a few better features. Note, Thrill 4G only displays 3D in horizontal view (EVO 3D can display 3D images in vertical and horizontal views), but this may just be a limit of the camera software and 3rd-party software may fix that (Common Google! And update YouTube to make finding 3D videos easier!).See a 3D glasses-free phone in person to appreciate the depth 3D creates! I love 3D photos, watch 3D movies, record 3D video, and play 3D games (I played 3D games on my 1986 SEGA Master System!). I'd love 3D interfaces and/or apps with 3D layered menus 3D zoom effects to manage items on small displays better. You could tilt your phone to "look around" 3D objects! Every phone should have 3D since 3D phones usually have a button to quickly toggle 3D on or off, because 3D is not for everyone, but it is for me!Recommended hardware upgrade for the future would be 3 camera lenses on the back of 3D phones to take 3D photos and video in ALL horizontal or vertical views!I also recommend the Case-Mate LG Optimus 3D Pop! Case w/Kickstand (available @ AT&T; & on eBay).  Drill a small hole above the hole on the bottom to create a lanyard anchor point!

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality and value .
Reviews.Author: Egbert Serrano
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality and value.Totally was received as described.Very pleased with purchase.Totally fast and in excellent condition.The quality of the images 3D are Very Good.the connectivity is fast.It recognizes all the mobile devices and provides fast connection nearby.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre, at best
Reviews.Author: Chris Glass "Chris"
Reviews.Content: I got this free when it first launched many years ago. I still keep it around and updated and use it from time to time for 3D photos and other random things I don't want on my normal phone.Currently it DOES run Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) which means it runs 99% of everything on the app store. The sd card slot and replacable battery are nice.The problem is hardware. There are major flaws somewhere in their OS design that makes the device incredibly laggy. It's very comparable to the Evo 3D (Which I have), but with a lower resolution screen, but better camera.But the lag ruins the device for me, above all else. The device shipped with Froyo, but on ICS, it's virtually unusable, unless you want to install a custom AOSP-style ROM like CyanogenMod, but then you lose all the 3D gimmicks, which defeats the entire purpose of owning the device.

Reviews.Author: Javier Guevara C.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I had many problems that remain to this day. after 1 year I managed to unlock it to use it in my country and after 3 months of use present serious problems again: "Sorry: The application xxx (com.android.xxx process) has stopped unexpectedly., please try again. FORCE CLOSE" no one in my country can fix it.

Reviews.Content: this phone if you love 3d its great because let you do it all in 3d without glasses the only probllem its that stucks in gingerbread

Reviews.Title: dont get used ones

Reviews.Content: Phones awesome. Used... but did not meet expectations from what I read. Minor surface damage. I can live with that. I work construction doesnt bother me. But said nothing about missing memory card slot. Big let down for me.

Reviews.Content: Hello . I purchased a phone from you guys through Amazon & I would just like to say that I am very glad I did . The phone came very quickly & it really did look brand new . I have also recommended your business to some of my friends who are looking for new phones .Thanks again (:

Reviews.Title: P925
Reviews.Author: Rafael
Reviews.Content: There isn't a P920, but a P925 (at&t;), u cant update to android 2.3 and this product USED, although I have requested a newDONT BUY HERE

Reviews.Title: 3D WOW, EVERYTHING ELSE SUB PAR!!!
Reviews.Author: A. J. Allison
Reviews.Content: I purchased the LG THRILL 3D P920 two months ago. I feel it was a pain to get because it seemed no one really stocked it. It finally arrived and I turned it on. Very nice look and feel to it. It's a sexy phone for it's size. I get a lot of compliments on how it "looks". The 3D is really mind blowing. It's really fascinating to see pics come out of the screen like that. That's about where it ends.The battery life is poor to say the least. Maybe 18 hours if you are using it "normally" like a phone call here and there, a pic or two, an email check once. But if your web surfing and listening to music and making calls alot, THIS IS NOT THE SMART PHONE FOR YOU! Your looking at 4-6 hours at best wen using it constantly.I'm new to ANDROID. So I did all the fancy schmancy "rooting" and so on. The phone will go through "fits" where it just turns on and off at random for a few hours then just stops? WTH? The screen can be "catchy" where sometimes it becomes unresponsive and I have to restart.The proccessor is slow to say the least.It has HORRIBLE, I mean HORRIBLE reception. It won't function in my office and we have a cell tower close. Most everyone in my office has no issues with thier phones, except me haha. The WiFi reception is also terrible. When everyone is boogying on hotspots I'm the guy moving my phone around the air looking like I'm trying to signal space aliens or something.The stuff that really matters, this phone is just sub-par at. Reception, battery life and general usability. I won't be going with another Android based phone either, but android vs IOS is just an opinion. IOS is better for me.But trust me on the 3D capability, WAY COOL!

Reviews.Title: Good phone, not amazing
Reviews.Author: Tygus
Reviews.Content: Not as fast as I thought, battery duration is very bad.Perhaps flashing a different rom can solve both issues.3D is very good.

Reviews.Title: A un-upgradable piece of crap
Reviews.Author: John Savu "johny"
Reviews.Content: The phone is big, small battery, the 3d is only a gimmick and the software upgrade to even an old version (gingerbread) is nowhere to be found.  The specks seem to be good but you'll be running Froyo!

Reviews.Title: A poor product from a really bad company
Reviews.Author: Sjusto
Reviews.Content: Guys, just forget about this phone.Buy it from a Cell phone builder, not from a dish washers.I have one and the experience has been terrible.Customer support sucks, upgrades, they never release any.I may get 2.6.3 when android 5 gets old.Hope this helps.Regards,
